title: Russian soldiers tell BBC they saw fellow troops executed on commanders' orders
partialText: Four men expose the horror and brutality of conditions in the Ukraine war, with two saying they saw soldiers being shot for refusing orders.

title: Phillipson defends student loan change and says average repayments will rise by £8 a month
partialText: Some graduates in England say "punishing" student loan repayments have led them to cut their hours at work.

title: BBC edited a second racial slur out of Bafta ceremony
partialText: The BBC's chief content officer Kate Phillips says a slur that aired was the result of a genuine error.

title: Nancy Guthrie's family offers $1m reward to bring home missing mother
partialText: Fighting back tears, the missing woman's NBC host daughter says they accept she may be dead.

title: GPs told to guarantee same-day appointments for urgent cases
partialText: New contract will require patients in England to be given immediate appointment if needed.

title: Man 'caused wife's death by controlling her', jury told
partialText: Christopher Trybus denies the manslaughter of his wife Tarryn Baird who took her own life in 2017.

title: First British baby born using transplanted womb from dead donor
partialText: Grace Bell, who was born without a viable womb, says her little boy is "simply a miracle".

title: Reform by-election campaign boss suspended over tweets
partialText: Reform UK's Gorton and Denton by-election interim campaign boss Adam Mitula made the posts on X.

title: Bowen: Why Ukraine remains defiant and does not feel close to defeat
partialText: This month marks four gruelling years since the full‑scale invasion began and a genuine ceasefire still feels far from assured

title: 'Anyone who runs is shot': Watch Russian soldiers describe killings of troops who refuse orders
partialText: The men, who are on the run, told of the horrors they witnessed on the Russian side of the front lines in Ukraine.

title: In maps: Tracking the war with Russia
partialText: How Russia's gradual gains in the face of fierce Ukrainian opposition have affected the front line in recent months.

title: I don't want him going abroad to die, says mum of son's assisted dying wish
partialText: Shelley Herniman was against Noah's wish for an assisted death but his suffering changed her mind.

title: Trump to address a changed America at vital moment for his presidency
partialText: Few of Donald Trump’s speeches to Congress have had as much riding on them as the one on Tuesday night.

title: 'A conman stole my money and bought his wife a 10-carat diamond ring'
partialText: US victims have lost hundreds of thousands of dollars to a gang of UK and Irish nationals, known as The Travelling Conmen.

title: Why it's going wrong for Aston Martin ahead of the new Formula 1 season
partialText: The combination of Adrian Newey, Honda and Fernando Alonso was highly promising but Aston Martin are in trouble. Andrew Benson explains why.

title: What happened to Arlene? The 30-year mystery of a murder without a body
partialText: Arlene Fraser's husband Nat is serving life for murder - but her family is still seeking answers about what happened to her body.

title: UK finally welcomes milder weather after rainy start to 2026
partialText: How high will temperatures reach and how long will stay mild? Darren Bett has the details.

title: Chocolate kept in anti-theft boxes as shops warn it's being stolen to order
partialText: Retailers and police forces tell the BBC that thieves are targeting chocolate and selling it on.

title: BBL death investigation dropped after suspect dies
partialText: Mum-of-five Alice Webb died in 2024 after becoming unwell following cosmetic treatment.

title: Government publishes thousands of Sturgeon inquiry files
partialText: Ministers have released a tranche of documents after the information commissioner launched legal action.

title: Lammy to lift cap on court sitting days to cut cases backlog
partialText: The justice secretary said every crown court in England and Wales will be funded to hear as many cases as possible next year.

title: Reddit fined £14m for 'concerning' child age check failings
partialText: The UK's data watchdog said the failings meant children could be exposed to harmful material online.

title: Mexico hunts 23 inmates sprung from jail during wave of violence
partialText: The prisoners escaped from a jail in Puerto Vallarta after armed men rammed one of the gates.

title: BBC News app
partialText: Top stories, breaking news, live reporting, and follow news topics that match your interests

title: Peter Mandelson Arrested
partialText: Lord Mandelson arrested on suspicion of misconduct in public office

title: A Woman's Hour and SEND in the Spotlight special
partialText: We hear from a range of voices on the impact of the government's SEND reforms in England.

title: 'It bothers me that Vinicius' celebration is being used against him'
partialText: Real Madrid goalkeeper Thibaut Courtois says Vinicius Jr's celebration against Benfica in last week's Champions League tie does not "justify a suspected act of racism".

title: Why Champions League return is crucial to Man Utd
partialText: Up to fourth in the Premier League after Monday's win at Everton, Champions League qualification would be a big boost to Manchester United's finances after two years outside Europe's elite club competition.

title: Ireland defeat reminiscent of end of my England era - Jones
partialText: Former England coach Eddie Jones says the team's defeat by Ireland left him feeling sick as it brought back memories of the end of his own time in charge.

title: New stadium curse - are Everton showing how clubs struggle after move?
partialText: As Everton's home form continues to struggle, BBC Sport takes a closer look at the curse of the new stadium in the Premier League era.

title: PSG's Hakimi to face trial after rape allegation
partialText: Paris St-Germain defender Achraf Hakimi says he is set to face trial after an allegation of rape was made against him.

title: Why has it gone so wrong for Aston Martin?
partialText: The combination of Adrian Newey, Honda and Fernando Alonso was highly promising but Aston Martin are in trouble. Andrew Benson explains why.
